artifact.content: A user must be able to place a call.
A user must be able to receive a call.
A user must be able to forward a call to any extension
To forward a call a user must press the �#� key and then dial the extension
When a user forwards a call and the destination extension is busy, the other party of the initial call gets busy signal
The user must be able to globally forward calls to their extension to another extension
A caller must be able to leave a voice message
A user must be able to sign for a Voice Mail service
A user must be able to log in to the Voice Mail System from any phone that is part of the system
To log in to the Voice Mail system a user must dial extension 6000
A user must be able to change the greeting message for their Voice Mail.
A user must be able to change the password of their voice mail box.
A user must be able to listen to voice messages in their voice mail box
A user must be able to delete voice messages from their voice mail box.
Once a connection between two users is established, they must be able to hear each other.
A call must end when either the caller or callee hangs up.
A user must hear dial tone once they pick the receiver.
A caller must hear busy tone after the extension of the callee has been dialed.
A caller must hear ring tone after the extension of the callee has been dialed.
A caller must hear fast busy tone after the extension of the callee has been dialed
A user must hear a tone after pressing a key on the keypad of the phone
A user must hear voice mail instructions when interacting with the Voice Mail system
A user must not be charged for checking their voice mail
The system must not charge a user when a call to administrator is placed
Billing for calls must be by the minute.
Only the caller is billed for a phone call
There is no upper limit on the duration of any call
Call processing must start once four digits (extension) are dialed by a caller
If a call is dropped for any reason, the charge for that call is for the duration of the call until the drop time
A user must not be able to call their own extension
A user must be able to change their calling plan
Administrator must be able to log in
Administrator must be able to log out
Administrator must be able to record a bill payment on the behalf of a user
Administrator must be able to print bill(s)
Administrator must be able to suspend a user account
Administrator must be able to activate a suspended user account
Administrator must be able to delete a user account
Administrator must be able to create a new user account
Administrator must be able to view user account history
Administrator must be able to modify user account attributes
Administrator must be able to add a new phone to the VIOP Network system
Administrator must be able to remove a phone from the VIOP Network system
Administrator must be able to set an upper bound on the number of live calls in the VOIP Network system at one time
Administrator must be able to request a hardware test
Administrator must be able to add a new calling plan to the system
Administrator must be able to delete a calling plan from the system
Administrator must be able to reset a call process
The VOIP Network system will have only one administrator
The system must notify the administrator and suspend an account in case of hardware and/or software failure
The system should prompt the administrator to print the last bill in case of account cancellation
Each bill should contain a list of phone records and the total charge for the billing period
The default billing period is the current period
The system should not allow more simultaneous calls than specified my the administrator
The system must provide a means for the administrator to check whether an extension is in use
The system must not permit a user to utilize the services provided by the network until an administrator has initialized their account
The system must provide a method for the administrator to initialize a user account
The system must provide a method for the administrator to view a user�s outstanding bill
The system must provide a method for the administrator to access logs of previously-run system tests
A user may have more than one account
The maximum number of active user accounts in the system cannot be more than the phones part of the system
There should be no restriction on the available extensions
The system does not need to be scalable beyond 10000 users
The system should log all activities of the administrator
All IP part of the system should be static
There should be only one administrator logged in at a time
When the system is connecting two IP telephones in a voice call, the call must be connected within 1 second to ensure a reasonable system response time
Time for administrator to learn how to comfortably use the administrator interface should not exceed one week when proper training and/or documentation is offered
System should be easily adaptable from a subscription-based service to an unlimited private internal communication network
Time for a user to learn how to comfortably operate supplementary services such as voice mail and call forwarding should not exceed one week
